intro: Galium ceratocarpon, commonly known as the small-leaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release minute seeds when mature. Galium ceratocarpon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
